books.title: The Economic Consequences of the Peace
books.author: John Maynard Keynes
books.summary: Keynes presents a first-hand account of the 1919 Paris Peace Conference and an analysis of the resulting Versailles treaty.

books.title: The Mucker
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A street tough undergoes a transformation as he navigates the dangerous worlds of Chicago’s slums, a South Pacific island, and the wilds of Mexico.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Just So Stories
books.author: Rudyard Kipling
books.summary: A collection of short humorous fables for children, most purporting to tell the origin of animal characteristics such as the camel’s hump.

books.title: You Never Can Tell
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A family recently returned to England navigates a comedy of errors when they accidentally meet their estranged husband and unknown father.

books.title: The Way of the World
books.author: William Congreve
books.summary: Two lovers are prevented from marrying due to a previous dalliance.

books.title: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur’s Court
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: An engineer from 19th-century Connecticut is sent back in time to King Arthur’s medieval England.

books.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his companion investigate further crimes and mysteries, culminating in a life-or-death struggle with an evil nemesis.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Now It Can Be Told
books.author: Philip Gibbs
books.summary: A British war correspondent recalls his experiences during the Great War.

books.title: Poirot Investigates
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A calculating Belgian detective and his wide-eyed companion investigate and solve a series of mysteries.

books.title: Through the Brazilian Wilderness
books.author: Theodore Roosevelt
books.summary: Theodore Roosevelt’s autobiographical account of his expedition into the uncharted depths of the Brazilian rainforest.

books.title: The New State
books.author: Mary Parker Follett
books.summary: The theory of group organization is formulated and applied in an attempt to design a truly democratic political state.

books.title: Idylls of the King
books.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson
books.summary: Twelve poems detailing the adventures of Arthur’s round table.

books.title: Lady Windermere’s Fan
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A witty comedy that subverts the harsh social codes of Victorian England.

books.title: Four-Day Planet
books.author: H. Beam Piper
books.summary: A young reporter gets caught up in intrigue and adventure chasing tallow-wax bounties with the monster hunters on Fenris, a planet with a two-thousand-hour day and four-day year.

books.title: The Madman
books.author: Khalil Gibran
books.summary: The first collection of poetry and short stories by Lebanese author Khalil Gibran.

books.title: The Everlasting Man
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton takes us through the history of man, rebuking common secular views and presenting the case for the Catholic Church.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.
